contextId.occurrenceNote: This is a double negative which can be expressed as a positive statement. Alternate translation: "Everyone gathered at least ten homers of quail" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublenegatives]])
contextId.glQuote: No one gathered less than ten homers of quail

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in a positive form. Alternate translation: "he will be clean on the seventh day only if he purifies himself the third day" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublenegatives]])
contextId.glQuote: if he does not purify himself the third day, then he will not be clean on the seventh day

contextId.occurrenceNote: This can be stated in a positive form. Alternate translation: "Open containers will remain clean only if they have covers" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublenegatives]])
contextId.glQuote: Every open container with no cover becomes unclean

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "them" refers to all of the people who were counted in the wilderness of Sinai. This can be stated in positive form. Alternate translation: "The only ones who were still alive were" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-doublenegatives]])
contextId.glQuote: There was not a man left among them, except
